channel.title: Data Science on Jasin
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science on Jasin

item.title: Customer Segmentation
item.description: Hackathon by Kantar Project done with : Jia Rong Chin, Jingyuan Zhang, Koh Shi En, Jonathan Wee and Kok Jin Wei 3rd-placed team overall Used transaction and items' calories data recommendations to identify customers buying too much unhealthy food Used customers demographic data to select areas, age groups etc. for promotion RFM-modelling on customers' media habits to identify media solutions to promote healthier eating and living Created recommender system, along with database of similar foods, to suggest healthier alternatives for unhealthy customers Dictionary of healthier alternatives from our recommender system Link to GitHub repository

item.title: EPL 2020/21
item.description: Analyzed players' stats from Kaggle dataset Comparing goals/assits with expected goals/assists Which attackers overperformed? Does the data corroborate with teams' styles of play? Which players were most decisive with their passes? Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Model Ensembling
item.description: Project to find best model for a given validation and hidden test data set Data cleaning for multiple fields Logistic Regression SMOTE Resampling Linear Discriminat Analysis Support Vector Machine XG Boost Ensembling all methods gave best results Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Model Exploration
item.description: Main takeaway from this simple project was that neural networks, while being ‘state of the art’, aren’t always the ideal solution, hence the need for simpler models such as linear regression! Simple data cleaning Created, adjusted and regularized neural networks Created lasso model Created random forest Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Office Database
item.description: Project done with : Allan Tay, Keith Tay, Gordon Tham Created a database to simulate an office of employees, departments, meeting rooms Created functions to simulate employees' activities such as booking of rooms and joining meetings Created triggers to simulate events as a result of employees falling sick ER diagram to visualize the database Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Sarcasm Redditector
item.description: Project done with : Wei Heng Lee, Lim Shao Kiat, Yilin Chen, Grace Chua Tool to determine which Reddit comments were sarcastic Created Long Short Term Memory (LSTM) and Term Frequency-Inverse Document Frequency (TF-IDF) models Tuned Tokenizer object to include special characters instead Used Global Vectors (GloVe) embedding layer Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Shill Bidders Classifier
item.description: Shill Bidding dataset on Kaggle Project done with : Jia Rong Chin, Jingyuan Zhang, Koh Shi En, Jonathan Wee and Kok Jin Wei Identified Shill Bidders' behaviour tendencies K-Means clustering using Within-Cluster-Sum-of-Squares (WCSS) and Silhouette Width t-distributed stochastic neighbor embedding (t-SNE) for visualization Used multiple classifiers such as Support Vector Machine (SVM) and Decision Tree t-SNE clustering visualization Link to GitHub repository
